explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques for stock market prediction.
explanations.supervised learning: The paper mentions regression and classification tasks, which are supervised learning approaches.
explanations.classification: The paper identifies classification as one of the key tasks in stock market prediction, specifically for trading signals like buy, sell, or hold.
explanations.regression: The paper mentions regression as a key task for forecasting future stock prices.
explanations.neural network: The proposed model integrates bidirectional long short-term memory (BiLSTM) networks and graph attention networks (GAT), which are types of neural networks.
explanations.deep learning: The paper employs deep learning techniques, specifically BiLSTM and GAT, for stock market prediction.
explanations.representation learning: The paper uses graph attention networks and an attention mechanism to learn representations of stock data.
explanations.long short-term memory: The paper uses bidirectional long short-term memory (BiLSTM) networks as part of the proposed model.
explanations.LSTM: The paper uses bidirectional LSTM (BiLSTM) networks for stock market prediction.
explanations.attention mechanism: The paper integrates an attention mechanism (AM) to align technical and fundamental insights for enhanced predictions.
